intro: Parabarium hainanense, commonly known as the Hainan parabarium, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Hainan in China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments within tropical forests. Its leaves are elliptical and have a smooth surface, while its flowers are usually white or pale yellow. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
